automationRunbooks.name: StartAzureV2VMs
automationRunbooks.description: Start Azure V2 VMs This Graphical PowerShell runbook connects to Azure using an Automation Run As account and starts all V2 VMs in an Azure subscription or in a resource group or a single named V2 VM. You can attach a recurring schedule to this runbook to run it at a specific time. The asso

automationRunbooks.name: StopAzureV2VMs
automationRunbooks.description: Stop Azure V2 VMs This Graphical PowerShell runbook connects to Azure using an Automation Run As account and stops all V2 VMs in an Azure subscription or in a resource group or a single named V2 VM. You can attach a recurring schedule to this runbook to run it at a specific time.

automationRunbooks.name: Register-VMDSC
automationRunbooks.description: This runbook registers Azure resource manager virtual machines with automation DSC service. These can either be Windows or Linux virtual machines that are supported with DSC. You can specify the whole subscription, a specific resource group, or an individual VM.

automationRunnowbooks.name: Azure Inventory using Powershell
automationRunnowbooks.description: Azure Inventory using Powershell Want to know about innovative and interesting ideas in Azure and automation? Check out my blog: https://manjunathrao.com.Version 2.0:I have changed the design of this script.

automationRunnowbooks.name: Authenticate to Azure using Azure RunAs account
automationRunnowbooks.description: This Graphical PowerShell runbook authenticates to Azure using the built in Azure RunAs account. It is useful when called from parent runbooks that want to easily authenticate against Azure before calling Azure activities.

dscConfigs.name: basic
dscConfigs.description: Two configs: basic.Chocolatey and basic.BoxStarter are available.
